term.title: acute toxicity

item.text: Adverse effects of finite duration occurring within a short time (up to 14 d) after administration of a single dose (or exposure to a given concentration) of a test substance or after multiple doses (exposures), usually within 24 h of a starting point (which may be exposure to the toxicant, or loss of reserve capacity, or developmental change, etc.).
Ability of a substance to cause adverse effects within a short time of dosing or exposure.
